remarks: Fibonacci's identity (actually due to Diophantus).  The product of two sums of two squares is also a sum of two squares.  We can take advantage of Gaussian integers here to trivialize the proof.  (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 19-Jun-2015.)
statement:
2sq.1 $e |- S = ran ( w e. Z[i] |-> ( ( abs ` w ) ^ 2 ) ) $.
mul2sq $p |- ( ( A e. S /\ B e. S ) -> ( A x. B ) e. S ) $.
